channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: It’s Now Illegal for Commercials to Be Too Loud in This State
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Now it's time for more states to adopt the same legislature.
item.content:encoded: California just signed a new law, Senate Bill 576. This is going to force streaming services like Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon Prime Video to stop blasting loud, jarring commercials that are way louder than the shows you're actually watching.

item.title: How to Crop Pictures in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Edit images in Microsoft's popular productivity programs.
item.content:encoded: Whether you want to focus on a particular part of a picture, remove distracting detail from the edges of a graphic, or reshape an image to fit a specific layout, the Crop tool in Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint is a useful and versatile feature. Here's how to use it.

item.title: The German Crossover Everyone Overlooks and Why It’s Worth Considering
item.dc:creator: Tyler Dupont
item.description: An underrated German crossover that blends performance, comfort, and quality at an impressive value.
item.content:encoded: In a market filled with flashy badges and big personalities, one German crossover often flies under the radar, but it shouldn’t. It delivers the refinement, performance, and build quality you’d expect from a premium brand, all without the inflated price tag or maintenance headaches.

item.title: Why That "Accept All Cookies" Button Is a Privacy Trap
item.dc:creator: Gaurav Shukla
item.description: The hidden cost of convenience on the modern web.
item.content:encoded: Cookie consent banners have become a common sight on the modern internet. While these banners were meant to offer users a genuine choice to opt out of unnecessary tracking, they've increasingly been subverted by dark patterns and manipulative UX design.

item.title: How to Disable YouTube Shorts
item.dc:creator: Mahesh Makvana
Cory Gunther
item.content:encoded: Not a big fan of YouTube's short-form videos in your feed and want to get rid of them? Unfortunately, there's no longer an official method to turn off YouTube Shorts, and while workarounds to hide them stopped working, you do have a few ways to block or otherwise see fewer Shorts. We'll show you how on iPhone, Android phone, and desktop computer.

item.title: Arduino Reveals Uno Q Board With Debian Linux, and a Qualcomm Acquisition
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: There's a new Arduino board on the way to compete with Raspberry Pi, and the company is being absorbed into Qualcomm.
item.content:encoded: Arduino boards are a popular choice for DIY electronics projects and embedded devices, especially in cases where a Raspberry Pi board or other single-board computer isn’t ideal. Now, the Arduino company has plans to be acquired by Qualcomm, while also revealing a new Uno Q board powered by Qualcomm hardware.

item.title: 12 New Prime Video Shows and Movies to Watch for October 2025
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: Prime Video is absolutely brimming with tricks and treats this month. And here are the tastiest new shows and movies for you to bite into!
item.content:encoded: Prime Video is a streaming service always brimming with great content. And not just old favorites, either. Each month brings with it plenty of killer TV and movie premieres for anyone hungry for something new to watch.

item.title: 10 New Movies to Watch on Netflix in October 2025
item.dc:creator: T.M. Amrita
item.description: Spooky season is here, and so are new movies on Netflix.
item.content:encoded: Settle into a cozy fall with your popcorn and warm drinks as Netflix's fresh new releases hit your watchlist. October is a great month for streaming, with several films, shows, documentaries, and old titles coming to the streaming platform.

item.title: Protect Your Family's Health This Prime Day With Waterdrop Filters
item.dc:creator: Sponsored
item.description: This post is sponsored by Waterdrop Filter
item.content:encoded: Nothing is as important in life as clean, healthy water. While water from the tap is generally safe in most places, that can change in the blink of an eye, and there's nothing wrong with having higher standards for water quality than the government offers.

item.title: How I Back Up My Home Assistant Server to iCloud, Google Drive, and More
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Putting all that cloud storage to good use.
item.content:encoded: You’re probably sick of hearing about how important backups are, especially for personal devices and precious files. One thing that can be easy to overlook is your smart home setup, which could take hours of work to restore if something goes wrong.
